intro: Acetosella commersonii, commonly known as mouse ear chickweed, is a low-growing perennial plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, spoon-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. Acetosella commersonii is known for its ability to tolerate shade and is sometimes used in ornamental gardening. Its botanical features make it a valuable component of ecological studies and habitat restoration projects.
